channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AZ
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for AZ

item.title: Report X-2023070975
item.description:
Report X-2023070975

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-09T18:14:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-12
  • City: TEMPE
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found wet, on a van line. Ops manager was informed and brought the package to the hazmat cage at 5:00am. DescribePack: One of the gallons seal under the bottle cap is corroded slightly, causing an opening (and subsequent leakage). DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package put into a lined, red, hazmat tote and placed under the vent hood in the hazmat cage.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was brought to damage cage from unload, because was leaking. DescribePack: Upon inspection, I saw the lid loose, causing internal leak. DurationRel: 32 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed into hazmat tote and hazmat bag, to prevent damage other packages

item.title: Report X-2023070948
item.description:
Report X-2023070948

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-09T18:14:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-11
  • City: YUMA
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was sent up the belt, when it began to leak. Package was immediately placed inside a hazmat tote in the upright position to prevent further leakage and taken to QA for inspection and processing. DescribePack: Package contained 4x1 Gallons. One of those gallons cap had fallen off and thus caused the leak. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Packages was immediately placed inside a tote in the upright position to prevent any further leakage.

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package arrived at QA leaking due to a loose cap. We placed package in a hazmat bag then in a yellow drum. DescribePack: One of the contents had a loose cap causing spillage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: We placed package in a hazmat bag then in a yellow drum, we also used absorbing pads to cleaned up the spill.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package arrived at QA leaking due to a loose cap. We placed package in a hazmat bag then in a yellow drum. DescribePack: Package came in with 4 plastic bottles inside and one of them had a loose cap causing leakage, also package didn't have enough inner packaging. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: We placed package in a hazmat bag then in a yellow drum.
